identified-content.person: VAN ORMAN, MARGARET JANE (MARGARET JANE HIGGINS)

block.p: Margaret Jane Van Orman, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Van Orman of Brooklyn Heights, was married yesterday to Todd Bryant Higgins, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Higgins of Sands Point, N.Y. The Rev. Harry J. Erdlen performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour in Manhattan.

Mrs. Higgins, 25, is an associate in the marketing department at the Chase Manhattan Bank. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University, where she was the captain of the women's squash team. Her father retired as the executive director of the Federal Reserve Employee Benefits System in Manhattan. Her mother, Mary Rodgers Van Orman, is an administrative law judge for the Health and Finance Departments of New York City..

Margaret Jane Van Orman, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Van Orman of Brooklyn Heights, was married yesterday to Todd Bryant Higgins, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Higgins of Sands Point, N.Y. The Rev. Harry J. Erdlen performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour in Manhattan.

Mrs. Higgins, 25, is an associate in the marketing department at the Chase Manhattan Bank. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University, where she was the captain of the women's squash team. Her father retired as the executive director of the Federal Reserve Employee Benefits System in Manhattan. Her mother, Mary Rodgers Van Orman, is an administrative law judge for the Health and Finance Departments of New York City..

Mr. Higgins, 24, is a stock trader at Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette, the investment bank in Manhattan. He also graduated from Princeton, where he was captain of the men's varsity lacrosse team. His mother, Judith Higgins, owns Memory Lane Antiques in Port Washington, N.Y., and Manhattan. His father is a partner in the Herald Realty Company in Manhattan and the president of University Childcare, an operator of day-care centers, also in Manhattan.
